claim: The 2009 Spanish Grand Prix had an average fastest lap speed of 199.6415625.
extra_info: Spanish Grand Prix is the name of race refers to name = 'Spanish Grand Prix'; average fastest lap speed refers to avg(fastestLapSpeed);
reasoning: The average fastest lap speed for the 2009 Spanish Grand Prix is 199.6415625, which exactly matches the claim.

content.text: I'll verify this claim by exploring the database schema and then querying for the average fastest lap speed of the 2009 Spanish Grand Prix.

input.description: List all tables in the database

content.content:
circuits              drivers               results             
constructorResults    lapTimes              seasons             
constructorStandings  pitStops              status              
constructors          qualifying          
driverStandings       races

tool_use_result.stdout:
circuits              drivers               results             
constructorResults    lapTimes              seasons             
constructorStandings  pitStops              status              
constructors          qualifying          
driverStandings       races

content.content:
CREATE TABLE races
(
    raceId    INTEGER
        primary key autoincrement,
    year      INTEGER default 0            not null,
    round     INTEGER default 0            not null,
    circuitId INTEGER default 0            not null,
    name      TEXT    default ''           not null,
    date      DATE    default '0000-00-00' not null,
    time      TEXT,
    url       TEXT unique,
    foreign key (year) references seasons(year),
    foreign key (circuitId) references circuits(circuitId)
);

tool_use_result.stdout:
CREATE TABLE races
(
    raceId    INTEGER
        primary key autoincrement,
    year      INTEGER default 0            not null,
    round     INTEGER default 0            not null,
    circuitId INTEGER default 0            not null,
    name      TEXT    default ''           not null,
    date      DATE    default '0000-00-00' not null,
    time      TEXT,
    url       TEXT unique,
    foreign key (year) references seasons(year),
    foreign key (circuitId) references circuits(circuitId)
);

content.content:
CREATE TABLE results
(
    resultId        INTEGER
        primary key autoincrement,
    raceId          INTEGER default 0  not null,
    driverId        INTEGER default 0  not null,
    constructorId   INTEGER default 0  not null,
    number          INTEGER,
    grid            INTEGER default 0  not null,
    position        INTEGER,
    positionText    TEXT    default '' not null,
    positionOrder   INTEGER default 0  not null,
    points          REAL   default 0  not null,
    laps            INTEGER default 0  not null,
    time            TEXT,
    milliseconds    INTEGER,
    fastestLap      INTEGER,
    rank            INTEGER default 0,
    fastestLapTime  TEXT,
    fastestLapSpeed TEXT,
    statusId        INTEGER default 0  not null,
    foreign key (raceId) references races(raceId),
    foreign key (driverId) references drivers(driverId),
    foreign key (constructorId) references constructors(constructorId),
    foreign key (statusId) references status(statusId)
);

content.text: Good, `fastestLapSpeed` exists in the `results` table. Now let me query for the average fastest lap speed of the 2009 Spanish Grand Prix.

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/formula_1.sqlite" "SELECT AVG(CAST(r.fastestLapSpeed AS REAL)) FROM results r JOIN races ra ON r.raceId = ra.raceId WHERE ra.year = 2009 AND ra.name = 'Spanish Grand Prix';"
input.description: Query average fastest lap speed for 2009 Spanish Grand Prix

content.text:
The query result is exactly **199.6415625**, which matches the claim precisely.
